page.title: 18HIGHLAND FOLK MUSEUM (4)
page.content:
Throughout the rest of the summer months{specialist days}were arranged. Music lovers could attend on a Tuesday to meet a{piper}and discuss his music. Wednesday could boast a{glass engraver or{horn carver.} On Thursday a {spinister}demonstrated her wheel and talked of wools and dyeing. {Food}was Friday's topic and oatcakes could be sampled after seeing them cooked on a smokey peat fire in the Blackhouse - somethng to be remembered I'm assured.
Regularly featured are life sized models of a tinker mending pots, a farmer's wife working in the field and a spinister at her wheel. Various wheeled vehicles have been lent by local residents including a traction engine, milk delivery cart and horse drawn carriage.
